candidates.title: Deleted fuzz Cargo.lock
candidates.body:
---
name: Pull Request
about: Pull Request checklist
title: ''
labels: ''
assignees: ''

---
If your PR is a work in progress, please feel free to create it and include a [WIP] tag in the PR name. We encourage everyone to PR early and often so that other developers know what you're working on.

Before submitting your PR for final review, please ensure that it:

* Includes a proper description of what problems the PR addresses, as well as a detailed explanation as to what it changes
* Explains whether/how the change is consensus breaking or breaks existing client functionality
* Contains unit tests exercising new/changed functionality
* Fully considers the potential impact of the change on other parts of the system
* Describes how you've tested the change (e.g. against Floonet, etc)
* Updates any documentation that's affected by the PR

candidates.title: Lower fees
candidates.body: Base fees changes to 0.000001, setting is renamed and made optional

candidates.title: Upgraded git2 to fix Windows build
Peers discovery
candidates.body:
- Fix related hoe the node is discovering the peers.
- CI, upgraded windows VM
- Bump mwc-node version

candidates.title: V5.3.7/deadlock
candidates.body:
- Deadlock fix. 
- Fix archive node compact-sync throttling on low end hardware.  
- Every 10 minutes try to add a new peers, so the network will never be static.

candidates.title: Streaming
candidates.body:
- send node data in streaming like mode. It should mitigate high latency problem.
- stabilize archive nodes
- Apple Silicone build

candidates.title: Handle correctly non compacted segments. Update UI so it can run on l…
candidates.body: Handle correctly non compacted segments. Update UI so it can run on latest MacOS.

candidates.title: Improved sync workflow
candidates.body: Updated sync locking strategy, so now more can be done in parallel

candidates.title: V5.3.3/sync
candidates.body: Implemented fast node sync based on PIBD approach to the headers. Optimized few workflows. Bug fixes.

candidates.title: mwc crate name and bump to version 5.3.4
Feature/rebase to v5.4.x
candidates.body:
name: Rebase to grin node v 5.3.2
---
Apply relevant changes from grin node starting from the rebase. Changes that required hardfork was postponed until MWC hardfork will happens (it is not planned for now). 
Feature Parallel Initial Block Download (PIDB) was adopted for MWC because grin's implenetation required consensus change that MWC tries eliminate. Instead PIDB sync required handshake where all party agreed on the required hash for data exchange.

candidates.title: update grin_secp256k1zkp version
candidates.body: rangeproof::clone() memory corruption and remove rustc-serialize in grin_secp256k1zkp new version

candidates.title: verify chain client and update croaring
Disable marketplace and making it a features temporaly
candidates.body: Had to disable libp2p, just the time to make a proper fix for https://github.com/mwcproject/mwc-node/issues/50

candidates.title: Adaptation for simple secp256k1 context w/o precomputation
candidates.body:
Related to the PRs in `rust-secp256k1-zkp` repo:
- https://github.com/mwcproject/rust-secp256k1-zkp/pull/4
- https://github.com/mwcproject/rust-secp256k1-zkp/pull/5
- https://github.com/mwcproject/rust-secp256k1-zkp/pull/6
- https://github.com/mwcproject/rust-secp256k1-zkp/pull/7

A simple secp256k1 context object is designed for type serialization/parsing functions, no explicit context is needed to avoid expensive pre-computations or dynamic allocations.

This will give a nice QoL improvement to avoid the `secp` locking for Ser/Deser.

A simple secp256k1 context object is designed for type serialization/parsing functions, no explicit context is needed to avoid expensive pre-computations or dynamic allocations.

This will give a nice QoL improvement to avoid the `secp` locking for Ser/Deser.

candidates.title: [NIT] Update rust-secp256k1-zkp to mimblewimble/rust-secp256k1-zkp latest

Related PR in `rust-secp256k1-zkp`: https://github.com/mwcproject/rust-secp256k1-zkp/pull/1
Update node dependency to latest `rust-secp256k1-zkp` version.

[`nit` branch only at this time, to be updated to master branch in the future, no later than delivering the whole NIT feature.]
